page.title: 07FUN RUN, NE Sutton Coldfield
page.content: Many people went to watch and some even took part in the Sutton Fun Run on 2nd June, an annual local event attracting 3500 entrants open to all age groups. The course is 10 miles long through Sutton's streets and park. Starting from the Gracechurch Centre the runners enter the park through Banners Gate, exit by Four Oaks Gate and finish back in Gracechurch. Finishers received medals. The event was sponsored by local firms, notably Ansells Brewery and Colliers Cars-the latter donated a car to be raffled. Many entrants had private sponsorship. The proceeds went to local causes e.g. Good Hope Hospital. Some ran in teams. The "ACROSS" team from Holy Trinity RC parish used its proceeds to send handicapped people to the shrine at Lourdes in France.
